title: Couple’s cheeky tactics win the keys at Hawthorn East auction
text:
A married couple tag teamed their way to victory at a Hawthorn East auction.

The three-bedroom townhouse at 1/56 Rathmines Rd sold for $1.07 million to the determined duo.

The pair stood apart, one dropping out of the auction early before the other took over bidding in an effort to intimidate two other parties.

RELATED: Auction market hitting straps before Melbourne Cup hurdle

East Melbourne auction: apartment sells $1.18 million above reserve

Hawthorn East period home replaced with identical new home

Ham Kerr Balwyn agent Joe Falzon said he wasn’t aware they were husband and wife during the auction.

“Once she stopped bidding, the husband stepped in against the others, which is not a bad tactic,” Mr Falzon said.

“They had spoken to a few friends before the auction who said it was a good ploy.”

The move could make other hopeful buyers drop out because of unexpected competition in the crowd, he added.

The husband swooped in towards the end of the auction with a $1 million bid after the property hit reserve at $990,000.

His tactics went a step further, dressed in a suit that had the crowd speculating he was a buyer’s advocate as he went back-and-forth with another party until the hammer fell.

Mr Falzon said the couple lived in Boroondara and planned to move into the home, which they would eventually renovate.

The vendor had lived there for 22 years.

“She has loved living here and she raised her two children here, but it’s time to downsize,” he said.

“It’s rare to find a three-bedroom home quoted for less than $1 million around here.”

The two-storey property had floor-to-ceiling windows, a north-facing courtyard and rear access to a park.

CoreLogic records show it previously sold for $236,000 in 1997.

READ MORE: Kensington try before you buy units combat cladding concerns

Puffing Billy’s neighbour: Cockatoo army barracks ready to renovate

Glen Waverley Secondary College zoning gets vendors extra $200K
description: A husband and wife who bid at auction with a few unusual tricks up their sleeve won the keys to a Hawthorn East townhouse, but couldn’t stop the price soaring $80,000 past reserve.
